text: Again, what is I want in French, I want?
Je veux.
He wants.
Il veut.
She wants.
Elle veut.
You informal want.
Tu veux.
You formal want.
Vous voulez.
We want.
Nous voulons.
How would you say we want to leave, we want to part?
Nous voulons partir.
We want to leave now.
Nous voulons partir maintenant.
We want to leave today.
Nous voulons partir aujourd'hui.
We want to leave this evening.
Nous voulons partir ce soir.
Finally, we want to leave later, literally more late.
Nous voulons partir plus tard.
We want to go.
Nous voulons aller.
We want to go there.
We want to go there.
And you're actually pointing as if to say just there.
Nous voulons aller là.
However, most of the time, you're going to replace la with the pronoun y.
Y.
And this is going to be used almost all the time in French, unless it's somewhere very near
and you really want to gesture towards it.
So this is what you're typically going to use when speaking French.
So, again, what is to go there using la?
Aller là.
And to go there, replacing it with y, which is a pronoun.
Y aller.
We want to go there.
Nous voulons y aller.
We want to go there later.
Nous voulons y aller plus tard.
He wants to go there later.
Il veut y aller plus tard.
What was they want, they want?
Ils veulent.
Again, in order to remember they want, they is of course,
il.
And he is also of course,
il.
So we can go back to he wants.
Again, what is he wants?
Il veut.
And this is how the word for they wants,
they want, will begin.
However, of course,
you need to add an additional consonant sound at the end
in order to distinguish it from he wants.
And the consonant sound can be found in the middle of want for you want.
So again, what was you want?
Vous voulez.
The middle consonant of which is an L in the middle of voulait.
So let's go back again to he wants, which is...
Il veut.
Now let's add that L sound to the end of he wants and it becomes...
Which is they want.
How would you say they want to wait?
They want to wait for me.
They want to await me.
They want to wait for me.
They want to wait for me.
They want to wait for me.
They want to wait for me.
They want to wait for me.
Finally, how would you say they want for an entirely female group?
They want to wait for me.
They want to wait for me.
They want to do it.
They want to do some of it.
They want to do some of it.
They want to do some of it now.
They want to do some of it.
They want to do some of it.
They want to do some of it now.
They want to do some of it now.
They want to do some of it now.
They want to do some of it now.
